newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Rebels in Zaire rail hub of Kamina-sources.
newsitem.headline: Rebels in Zaire rail hub of Kamina-sources.

text.p: Rebels fighting to topple veteran President Mobutu Sese Seko have taken control of the rail hub of Kamina in Zaire's southern mining province of Shaba, expatriate sources said on Monday.
The rebels moved into town, which was once a major military base with an airfield, on Sunday or early Monday without a fight, the sources added.
Kamina is 600 km (400 miles) or a 24-hour rail journey north of the provincial capital Lubumbashi, a declared rebel target.
"The railway line was cut at Kamina. The rebels are in Kamina," one expatriate source told Reuters.
It was not immediately clear where the soldiers from the town had gone but the sources said that many had already pulled out, leaving just a handful of paramilitary gendarmes.
There were no reports of looting, the scourge of Zairean civilians in the path of retreating ill-disciplined Zairean soldiers.
The sources said that the rebels had advanced on foot along the railway line from Kalemie on Lake Tanganyika, a town they seized earlier in the conflict.
The sources had no details on numbers of rebels in Kamina.

The Sizarail Belgian and South African consortium operates the rail line, which supplies the diamond-mining province of Kasai with goods from Southern Africa. Before it took over the then dilapidated line two years ago, supplies were flown in.
